image.altText: A police vehicle parked in front of a house painted in green.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have charged a man with murder after a woman was killed in an alleged domestic violence incident in Alice Springs on Sunday.

title.children: Man charged with murder after Alice Springs woman found dead

image.altText: A woman addresses the media in a press confernece.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has joined all other jurisdictions in establishing a lobbyist register. It comes as the government also defunds two influential environmental groups.

title.children: NT government creates lobbyist register, defunds environment groups

image.altText: A generic image of two NT Police officers at work on the streets.

props.synopsis: The NT government is introducing a new law which grants police "express powers" to enter private property to search for parole or domestic violence offenders.

title.children: Police to conduct alcohol testing on private property in DV law change

image.altText: The front of the Alice Springs police station.

props.synopsis: Two Aboriginal women held in the Alice Springs watch house have described the "disgusting" conditions, saying cells are so full inmates sometimes have to share mattresses.

title.children: Peak Aboriginal bodies say Alice Springs watch house conditions 'inhumane'

image.altText: A sign telling visitors not to enter the property

props.synopsis: Farmers are celebrating the federal government's decision to withdraw the proposed biosecurity levy bill, which would have seen $50 million per year collected from the agricultural sector.

title.children: Biosecurity levy proposal scrapped in 'huge win' for farmers

image.altText: An Aboriginal family standing in a supermarket (man, woman and child), holding a trolley.

props.synopsis: As remote communities across Australia wait to find out whether they'll receive federal government help to reduce grocery prices, the NT's largest Indigenous community is finding its own solutions to limit food inflation.

title.children: As remote communities wait for government food support, this town has its own solutions

image.altText: The Aboriginal flag flies against a blue sky.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has confirmed it has scrapped the jurisdiction's bid for a treaty with Aboriginal people, officially ending a seven-year process. Treaty advocates say the move is "saddening" and "ignorant".

title.children: 'Saddening': Treaty plans scrapped in the NT, ending seven-year process

image.altText: mango tray

props.synopsis: Scientists find the cause of mango twig tip dieback, eight years after the mysterious disease emerged in the Top End. Farmers say the discovery is a "first step" to treating the disease, which can drastically reduce mango yields.

title.children: Darwin researchers discover cause of mysterious mango disease

image.altText: A close-up of Lia Finocchiaro as she addresses the media.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory chief minister has vowed to crack down on environmental "lawfare" by removing the ability for third parties to challenge economic project approvals through a civil tribunal.

title.children: NT chief targets 'activists' in new bill to be introduced in parliament

image.altText: A white gloved hand holds a small pile of brown earthy material above a bag full of the stuff.

props.synopsis: Each year Australians waste more than seven million tonnes of food at a cost of $36.6 billion to the economy. A Darwin enterprise is doing its bit to change that.

title.children: Indigenous business works to divert tonnes of food waste from tip

image.altText: A bald man walks next to a woman with brown hair in a ponytail who is smiling at something out of frame

props.synopsis: The jury was left with just three things to consider after a week-long trial that spent hours examining a 34-minute police video and the hours that led to the words "stupid and white".

title.children: Sam Kerr's not guilty verdict boiled down to three things

image.altText: A woman in a black suit looks solemn, walking besides a lawyer dressed in official attire

props.synopsis: On the final day of Antoinette Lattouf's unlawful termination case against the ABC, her former manager agreed that she was told posting information from a reputable organisation on social media was allowed.

title.children: Lattouf was told posting information from 'reputable organisation' was OK

image.altText: Clive speaks at a podium in front of a blue National Press Club of Australia backdrop and gestures with his hands.

props.synopsis: Clive Palmer has lost his High Court bid to re-register the United Australia Party for this year's federal election, meaning the party's candidates will not be identified with the UAP on ballot papers for the House of Representatives and the Senate.

title.children: Clive Palmer loses bid to re-register United Australia Party

image.altText: A submarine moves through the water causing a massive wake behind it, some crew visible above deck.

props.synopsis: Former PM Malcolm Turnbull believes AUKUS is a "one-sided", bad deal, although the security partnership has cross party support in Australia. So how could the arrival of new US president Donald Trump impact the deal?

title.children: Will AUKUS survive Trump? Defence experts and critics weigh in

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference in brisbane

props.synopsis: Labor has been accused of reigniting its "Mediscare" campaign ahead of the federal election with a misleadingly edited attack ad in which opposition leader Peter Dutton declares "Medicare is dead".

title.children: Labor accused of 'disinformation' with misleading Dutton ad

image.altText: The outside of an aircraft printed with the letters REX in blue and orange

props.synopsis: The federal government says it is prepared to acquire Regional Express if administrators are unable to find a buyer for the collapsed airline in an upcoming sales process.

title.children: Regional Express to be government-owned if airline fails to find buyer

image.altText: An elderly Aboriginal man looks at the camera with grey hair and a blue shirt

props.synopsis: Stolen Generations survivor Uncle Michael 'Widdy' Welsh was optimistic that change was coming when a groundbreaking national inquiry was launched to bring light to history, recognising experiences like his.

title.children: 'It’s been almost a whole generation': Survivors call on governments to act

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair looks serious.

props.synopsis: Rent crisis among the lowest-income First Nations households as new research drills down on the 'unmet' housing needs.

title.children: First Nations people experience higher rates of unmet housing needs

image.altText: A car drives past a cyclone warning sign on the side of a country road.

props.synopsis: The category two system is expected to continue to intensify before crossing the coast later this week.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Zelia forms off WA coast with up to 500mm rain expected

image.altText: A composite of a high-rise building, workers in hi-vis vests and a smiling couple.

props.synopsis: A former safety officer has blown the whistle on a culture of "fear and intimidation" within Australia's biggest apartment developer.

title.children: Meriton ignored safety orders as workers 'in fear' on luxury high-rise

image.altText: Belle Gibson, with her hair in a ponytail, wearing black sunglasses and a black coat.

props.synopsis: Netflix is purporting to tell the story of wellness scammer Belle Gibson in their new series, but the show stops short of showing the messy legal fallout following Gibson's professional implosion.

title.children: Here's what Apple Cider Vinegar leaves out about Belle Gibson

image.altText: The exterior of a Commonwealth Bank branchm including the brand's logos.

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest bank has increased its profit and raised its dividend despite a "challenging period" for many customers. It has revealed 65,000 "tailored payment arrangements" are in place to help borrowers manage loan repayments.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank beats expectations with $5.1b profit and dividend rise

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market seesaws as reporting season ramps up, while the country's biggest bank's half-year profit beats estimates. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Banks drop fixed rates ahead of RBA meeting, CBA profit rises, ASX seesaws

image.altText: A woman holds three small tubs of different flavoured ice cream.

props.synopsis: Is eating a big bowl of ice cream healthy? Some studies suggest it is, but that's not the end of the story. We dig through what the evidence tells us about nutrition, and explore our relationship with food.

title.children: Is ice cream good for you? Here's why some studies say it is

image.altText: Melissa Wu holds up her Tokyo Olympics bronze medal.

props.synopsis: Five-time Olympian Melissa Wu announces her retirement, content with the decision to call time on her decorated career.

title.children: Aussie Olympic great Wu calls time on diving career

image.altText: Sara Errani (left) and Andrea Vavassori during the 2024 US Open mixed doubles tournament.

props.synopsis: Tennis stars criticise US Open officials for scheduling the mixed doubles during fan week at this year's tournament in New York.

title.children: US Open organisers lashed for 'terribly shocking' mixed doubles change

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a blue suit and red tie with lips pouted mid-sentence in front of a blurred painting of George Washington

props.synopsis: Really, it's a wonder the NSW government bothered to spend $16 million bringing UFC to Sydney, when we have a free cage sport: Trade negotiations with our closest allies.

title.children: There's a new cage fight in town: trade negotiations with our closest allies

image.altText: Colourful graphic with a photo of Anthony Albanese centre, surrounded by a house, Donald Trump, nuclear reactors and a tree.

props.synopsis: Primary school students were handed a microphone to ask Anthony Albanese anything they wanted — and they didn't shy away from the heavy topics.

title.children: The questions kids are most desperate to ask the prime minister

image.altText: Judge Salvatore Vasta

props.synopsis: Federal Circuit Court Judge Salvatore Vasta has won his High Court bid for immunity from being sued by a man wrongly jailed during a family property dispute.

title.children: Federal Circuit Court Judge wins High Court bid for immunity

image.altText: A glass pipe used to smoke meth.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police allegedly found phones, cash and 10kg of meth in a car driven by a 20-year-old who is expected to face court today.

title.children: Young man charged after $3m worth of meth found in car

image.altText: Employees of Kyushu Electric Power restart operations inside the central control room at Sendai nuclear power station

props.synopsis: As Japan grapples with new crises, nuclear power is once again being seen as the energy of the future.

title.children: 'They simply lack a plan B': Why Japan is betting big on nuclear power

image.altText: Two men are walking in from of shattered concrete, one with a blue gas tank on his right shoulder and one with a bag.

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the ceasefire in Gaza will end if the Palestinian militant group Hamas does not release hostages by Saturday.

title.children: Netanyahu will 'terminate' ceasefire if hostages not back by Saturday

image.altText: sharks seen from below circling under water

props.synopsis: As the number of shark attacks decline globally, a new report reveals how many incidents occurred in 2024.

title.children: US had triple the unprovoked shark bites compared to Australia in 2024

image.altText: Lightning bolt and purple stormy sky

props.synopsis: A global team of researchers has turned its focus to an earlier detection of lightning strikes which cause devastating bushfires in Australia every year.

title.children: Australian universities join NASA to combat fires sparked by lightning

image.altText: The logos of the four big banks in Australia

props.synopsis: APRA will also clarify that property developers do not need to have sold all units off the plan to get a loan.

title.children: Access to home loans to be easier for buyers with student debt
